document.title: ALBUQUERQUE PUBLIC SCHOOLS Gifted Handbook - Fall 2008

82C418492A1D456E8CAB4543EB04D71C.description: The gifted student needs to make progress in learning commensurate with his/her ability in a variety of subject areas.

83952C22EC1044B785272B93A78D49A4.description: Criterion referenced tests, mentor reports, learning skills checklist.

B892535FA7CC414EAA28A035E2C84DAE.description: Advanced Knowledge Student has quick mastery and recall of information and needs little teacher explanation of routine tasks.

744FC9D642B34D33B757D8A663613287.description: VIII. Achievement Accessing appropriate alternative educational opportunities

0D4F50B99FDF4D268FBE467455806116.description: The gifted student needs the opportunity to pursue a self-selected topic and/or area of career interest in an in-depth manner.

D7DBE51DEC594F928AB69838D8AF2192.description: Teacher ratings, self-observation report instruments, learning style inventories.

92225F6FA8A7425292CDE8FC64B047A9.description: Independence The student has strong selfmanagement skills, is goal oriented and requires minimal teacher direction.

FE659F9624D6450199CD7A243152339F.description: VII. Skills of the Independent Learner Independent study skills, Evaluation skills, Accessing community, Mentorship/Internship

4A17096550EE4CA5A38457D11D8DB1B1.description:
The gifted student needs the
stimulation resulting from the
opportunity to evaluate, reinforce, and
extend learning, thinking, and verbal
communication skills and interaction
with intellectual peers.

246C932836C74D82B1975E3CEE5E8903.description: Pupil products, teacher rating scales, diagnostic testing, evaluation of discussion expression which includes analytical skills, anecdotal records, learning skills checklist.

A20F96782A0246129C5FE2A8652C8D6C.description:
Communications
The student uses a richness of
elaboration and fluency in verbal and
non-verbal areas. He/She needs the
opportunity to communicate ideas.

2C71D6EAD6B64FA682A8615899B58A0F.description:
VI. Communication
Listening skills, Oral and written skills,
Non-verbal communication skills,
Discussion skills

E5B4064FC1374B36AAB6DD65238C05EB.description:
V. The gifted student needs an expanded
awareness of alternatives in order to
develop areas of continued interest.

F057349ABF69420D9860ED7A9CD9A477.description:
V. Teacher anecdotes and ratings,
interest surveys, case study
information, written products,
recommendation, references from
community members.

0290E55DB8D7432AB170167815070428.description:
V. Wide Range of Interests
The student is curious and has a
storehouse of information in varied
areas.

FD7A78AF7F9B4EC4A69591943F5C67DC.description:
V. Interest Development
Wide range of interest, Career
Exploration, Arts Experience,
Community/Global Awareness

83292EB504BC4777B0A1ED95D6DE77AC.description: The gifted student needs to develop his/her creative abilities as a necessary part of his/her human growth.

07FB028560EF408999988EBC26AE84F4.description: Tests of creativity, teacher and student observation, peer ratings, Renzulli Rating Scale, student journals.

95E7A88EFA9A4CAB834EF131AB99EA9A.description: Creativity Student has a keen sense of humor, is inventive, and a risk taker. He/She is one who uses originality, divergent thinking.

908E510C69814DD8B6DACA240A369A68.description: IV. Creativity Problem solving, Creative Thinking, Abstract Expressiveness

43A0A67D43BF4CBABCF31D4F2B434565.description: The gifted student needs to develop and use critical thinking.

7E6928651CA44B86BE0128DC8261AE34.description: Tests of critical thinking, analysis of discussion, and written communications, rubrics.

BFE066F0925C46F992432961F1E3BFD3.description: Advanced Conceptualization Student has high cognitive and problem solving abilities including convergent and divergent thinking skills.

8C1BB17845334A27893EC1D7737EF9FD.description: III. Thinking Skills Critical thinking, Decision making, Problem Solving, Logic

058E96583C03455C96400DC805704957.description: The gifted student needs to develop the skill to facilitate and participate in human interaction in diverse situations.

7D94BB1A81E64E13AD2299C340C81D31.description: Socio-grams, peer ratings, Renzulli Student Leadership Scale, teacher and student bring observations, anecdotal records. s) Leadership, Conflict Resolution (i.e. negotiation, compromise) Cooperation and Teamwork, Presentation of Self.

72E7B99CD2DF4104B34EA734CA9AA58A.description: Leadership Student is assertive, likes to organize and structure to people and situations. He/She is dependable, influential, persuasive, and a risk taker.

B677596E484B421FBB4577839950E11A.description: II. Interpersonal Skills (i.e. group dynamics) Leadership, Conflict Resolution (i.e. negotiation, compromise) Cooperation and Teamwork, Presentation of Self.

F97DAFDAFF934E0680C12BFF2A196D4D.description: The gifted student needs to develop a good understanding of his/her exceptionality (i.e. strength, weaknesses, and style of learning

97EF5E2344DF4FCC824FAD3E93E0EB0C.description: Counselor reports, teacher/parent rating scales, student self-concept scales, student journals.

BCDEE3028C2747A089B37F0119F3E6F3.description: Sensitivity and Perceptiveness Student is concerned with right and wrong. He/She is empathetic, and concerned with social issues.

01F0CD4CBD06451EAAC29D9F147FD983.description: I.  Self-Understanding-Self-Acceptance Preferred learning, behavioral and management styles. Sense of personal responsibility.

FC9798A189994E60A291EBD8CDA843F1.description: GIFTED STUDENTS MAY HAVE THE FOLLOWING CHARACTERISTICS
